1.name: The Great Train Robbery
1.description: A group of bandits stage a brazen train hold-up, only to find a determined posse hot on their heels.

2.name: Alice in Wonderland
2.description: Alice dozes in a garden, awakened by a dithering white rabbit in waistcoat with pocket watch. She follows him down a hole and finds herself in a hall of many doors. A key opens a small door...                See full summary »

3.name: Electrocuting an Elephant
3.description: The execution of Topsy, a female elephant, in a publicity stunt advertising the opening of Luna Park on Coney Island. Topsy was originally owned by Forepaugh Circus where she killed a ...                See full summary »

4.name: Life of an American Fireman
4.description: A fireman rushes into a carriage to rescue a woman from a house fire. Breaks the window glasses and he goes down with the woman. After dangerous and uncertain moments, the fireman save the woman' s son, too.

5.name: Le royaume des fées
5.description: In this spectacular free adaptation of the popular theatre play "La Biche au Bois", the valiant Prince Bel-Azor pursues a baleful old witch to her impregnable castle, to save the beautiful young Princess Azurine.

6.name: Japanese Foot Juggler
6.description: This pictures shows the world-famous Kitamura, the Japanese Foot Juggler. Watch him juggle a live Japanese boy with his feet, never touching him with his hands. It is truly marvelous, and ...                See full summary »

7.name: Uncle Tom's Cabin
7.description: Based on the novel by Harriet Beecher Stowe: Eliza, a slave who has a young child, pleads with Tom, another slave, to escape with her. Tom does not leave, but Eliza flees with her child. ...                See full summary »

8.name: La vie et la passion de Jésus Christ
8.description: The story of Jesus Christ from the proclamation of his Nativity to his crucifixion. Impressive scenes and dynamism of the actors prelude to the Italian colossal movies of the silent period.

9.name: The Great Train Robbery
9.description: The first scene shows the chief as he explains to his followers the plan of the great train robbery. Two masked robbers enter and compel the operator to stop the approaching train. They ...                See full summary »

10.name: Rip Van Winkle
10.description: An abridged version of the tale of Rip Van Winkle, a lazy American man, who wanders off one day with his dog Wolf into the Kaatskill mountains where he runs into an odd group of men ...                See full summary »

11.name: Faust aux enfers
11.description: Scenes. 1. The Route to the Depths of Perdition (a Dazzingly Sensational New Effect.) 2. The Fantastical Ride. 3. The Gloomy Pass. 4. The Stream. 5. The Entrance to the Lower Regions. 6. ...                See full summary »

12.name: The Gay Shoe Clerk
12.description: A woman being fitted for shoes exposes her ankle to the shoe clerk, who is intrigued. He kisses her, but her chaperone hits him with her umbrella.

13.name: Mary Jane's Mishap
13.description: Smith casts his wife as a sluttish housewife who is mutilated by lighting her oven with paraffin.

14.name: Le chaudron infernal
14.description: Two demons throw helpless captives into a boiling cauldron, and then try to summon forth their spirits.

15.name: Le cake-walk infernal
15.description: Deep into a vast cavern of the pitch-black inferno, a couple of professional dancers demonstrate the cakewalk that is currently so much in vogue, and now, everyone in the once-gloomy underworld is doing the crazy dance. Who is the best?

16.name: Les aventures de Robinson Crusoé
16.description: Robinson Crusoe and Friday fight with hostile natives, and eventually retire to their jungle cottage to relax.

17.name: Le chat botté
17.description: An old miller, feeling that his end is near, assembles his three sons to divide his property among them. He leaves his mill to the oldest, his land and property to the second, and when his ...                See full summary »

18.name: Le monstre
18.description: An Egyptian prince has lost his beloved wife and he has sought a dervish who dwells at the base of the sphinx. The prince promises him a vast fortune if the dervish will only give him the ...                See full summary »

19.name: The Man with the Iron Jaw
19.description: You have heard of Goliath. Well, here is his picture, swinging with his teeth a ball weighing 90 pounds as though it were a toy balloon. Very good, clear and lots of action.

20.name: The Sick Kitten
20.description: A girl gives a spoonful of medicine to a kitten.

21.name: A Romance of the Rail
21.description: An engaged couple, dressed in white, meet each other at a train station. When the train arrives, they get on board, and they enjoy the sights from the platform on the last car. The workers ...                See full summary »

22.name: La lanterne magique
22.description: In this brief "trick film" two clowns assemble an enormous magic lantern which first projects moving images, then emits dancing girls.

23.name: Le mélomane
23.description: The leader of a marching band demonstrates an unusual way of writing music.

24.name: A Chess Dispute
24.description: A stationary camera looks on as two dapper gents play a game of chess. One drinks and smokes, and when he looks away, his opponent moves two pieces. A fight ensues, first with the squirting...                See full summary »

25.name: Un malheur n'arrive jamais seul
25.description: The scene takes place in front of a barrack, where a young soldier is on duty --most laughable and comical.

27.name: La belle au bois dormant
27.description: The baptism of the Princess. The fatal spinning-wheel. The Prince is smitten with the Princess. The three cross-roads. The haunted inn. Fairy palace. The mysterious oak. The fairy grotto. The Princess awakes.

28.name: The Three Musketeers
28.description: D'Artagnan and his musketeer comrades must thwart the plans of Cardinal Richelieu to usurp King Louis XIII's power.

29.name: Le puits fantastique
29.description: Denied a handout, a witch exacts vengeance by cursing the village well.

30.name: A Message from Mars
30.description: A Martian visits a selfish man in order to make him change his ways.

31.name: Before and After
31.description: Moonlight garden scene. A couple wearing masks are walking through the garden. They sit down on a bench and the young man begins to make love to his partner. He removes his mask and asks ...                See full summary »

32.name: La guirlande merveilleuse
32.description: A musketeer bows to the audience and proceeds to hang his hat, coat and vest on the wall in a most amazing manner. Being in need of two pages, he brings them out of his coat, and with rope ...                See full summary »

33.name: L'oeuf du sorcier ou L'oeuf magique prolifique
33.description: A human skeleton is placed upon a table by an attendant. When the attendant leaves the room the skeleton begins kicking his legs and throwing his arms about and suddenly turns into a ...                See full summary »

34.name: A Desperate Poaching Affray
34.description: Three hunters surprise two poachers in the act. The hunters take umbrage and give chase over fences and through fields. The hunters fire away, but the poachers have guns as well, and a ...                See full summary »

35.name: Akt-Skulpturen. Studienfilm für bildende Künstler
35.description: A nude couple pose in an art studio on a square rug, while the camera does a circular traveling around them; the woman has her right knee on the floor and her right arm raised in front of ...                See full summary »

36.name: L'oracle de Delphes
36.description: A thief attempts to steal treasure from the tomb of Delphi when a spirit appears. He brings two statues come to life, who in turn transform to thief's head into that of a donkey.

37.name: Faust et Méphistophélès
37.description: A re-telling of the classic tale of Faust in all of two minutes by French filmmaker Alice Guy (later known as Alice Guy-Blaché).

38.name: Los héroes del sitio de Zaragoza
38.description: A short drama featuring three fictitious scenes of Spanish War Independence.

39.name: What Happened in the Tunnel
39.description: A woman riding a train must contend with the unwelcome advances of a male passenger.

40.name: President McKinley and His Cabinet on the Reviewing Stand, at Fairmount Park, Phila., May 27, 1899
40.description: The Chief Magistrate of the Nation is here shown reviewing the soldiers, and also the boys from the Cruiser Raleigh, who returned from Manila. The film is a beautiful lively subject, full ...                See full summary »

41.name: L'auberge du bon repos
41.description: A traveler is shown to a room in an inn. After a brief dispute with the hostess and a porter, he is left to himself. But strange things begin to happen in his room, and before long he has ...                See full summary »

42.name: Fun in an Opium Joint
42.description: One of our funniest pictures is this. It shows two Chinamen sitting on the floor "hitting the pipe." Presently they repair to their bunks which are placed one over the other. The chink in ...                See full summary »

43.name: La boîte à malice
43.description: As scene as pleasing as incomprehensible. A juggler summons two chairs, which come to the stage jumping and twirling around. Across the back of these chairs the operator places a sheet of ...                See full summary »

44.name: Le tonnerre de Jupiter
44.description: Brief "trick film" in which Zeus and two other gods romp with dancing girls on Olympian clouds.

45.name: Victor Hugo et les principaux personnages des Misérables

46.name: Le sorcier
46.description: Two guards bring a sorcerer into the hall of a palace of the time of the Middle Ages. The king who follows them orders the sorcerer to be chained and to be condemned to death for his ...                See full summary »

47.name: Lady Bountiful Visits the Murphys on Wash Day
47.description: This is a splendid comedy scene. Lady Bountiful, stylishly dressed, is standing in front of the wash tub talking to Mrs. Murphy. The small boy places the end of Lady Bountiful's train in ...                See full summary »

48.name: Chicago Fire Boats in Action
48.description: This picture is one of the most novel ever presented in motion photography. The film shows the fire boat at work with all of the nozzles in full play and the effects of the columns of water...                See full summary »

49.name: He Loves Me, He Loves Me Not
49.description: A study in moods. A handsome girl is plucking the petals of a daisy, and repeating the well-known doggerel. The first daisy tells her that her lover loves her not, but she determines to try...                See full summary »
